title: Electronic platform for repo in corp bonds likely, says RBI
text:
The Reserve Bank of India on Thursday said the introduction of an electronic platform for facilitating repo in corporate bonds will be considered for implementation.
In its annual report 2014-15, the the central bank pointed out that a deep and liquid corporate bond market has been a shared policy goal of the government of India (GoI) and financial regulators.
“Introduction of an electronic platform for facilitating repo in corporate bonds will be considered for implementation,” it said.
The apex bank also indicated that policy regarding overseas issue of rupee bonds will be finalised soon.
The draft framework on overseas issuance of rupee linked bonds by multilateral financial institutions and eligible borrowers was placed in the public domain and the policy in this regard is likely to be finalised soon, RBI said in the report.
In the monetary policy statement of April 2015, the Reserve Bank, in consultation with the GoI, decided to permit Indian corporates eligible to raise ECBs to issue rupee denominated bonds overseas.
The RBI is also exploring ways by which banks can enhance corporate bond credit ratings through credit facilities.
“Ultimately, though, a robust bankruptcy system is needed for the corporate bond market to really take off. The government has indicated it will move quickly to put this in place,” RBI said in its report.
The final guidelines for banks in regard to providing partial credit enhancement to corporate bonds is also underway, it said.
During 2014-15, ways to incentivise corporates to reduce dependence on bank finance for their long-term resource requirements were explored and draft guidelines were issued to banks to provide partial credit enhancement to corporate bonds.
